metadata.synopsis: This camp relationship dialog happens after OM between Astarion and Blood Merchant is done (next night in the camp).Different reactions from Astarion depending on the player choices during the OM.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Recruit - CompanionAstarion - Relationship - Start relationshipAstarion - Act 2 - Romance - Queue night (Allowed)or Astarion - Act 2 - Romance - Queue night (Stopped)Agreed to go to the camp. Click on the bed.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: I can still taste that vile drow in my throat.

142.speaker: Astarion
142.text: I don't know what I am.

171.speaker: Astarion
171.text: Throwing your body at someone becomes second nature. And I just did it again.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I shouldn't have pushed you to bite her.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: It's all right. I didn't expect myself to feel anything.

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: I forced myself to bite her.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: I'm so used to my body being used as a tool to get what someone else wants. But I'm free now. It shouldn't be like that.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: I'm sorry. I don't want you to do anything you don't want to do.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: I've seduced people who repulsed me more times than I can count.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: It should've just been another moment of disgust for greater reward.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: Huh. We shouldn't be involved with each other any more. I'll sleep alone.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: I only had our best interests at heart.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: You make your own choices now - for better or worse.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I didn't expect it to bother you at all.

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: I didn't think twice when the moment came, but now I can't get it off my mind.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: You can still throw your body at me, any time.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'm sure I can take your mind off her...

106.speaker: Astarion
106.text: Really? After something like that, you think that's what I'm looking for?
106.context: NodeContext: Incredulous/hurt that you're looking for sex when he's trying to talk about something

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: I was just defiled by that creature, and you let it happen. You made it happen!

146.speaker: Player
146.text: It was worth it for that potion.

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: For what you said while I was in front of that vile drow.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: I spent two hundred years using my body to lure pretty things back for my Master. What I wanted, how I felt about what I was doing, it never mattered.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: You could have asked me to do the same - to throw myself at her, what I wanted be damned. But you didn't. And I'm grateful.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: I don't want you to do anything you don't want to do.

187.speaker: Astarion
187.text: It's a novel concept, I admit. And a little intimidating.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: It would have been so easy to bite her. To just go along with what I was being told to do.

133.speaker: Astarion
133.text: A moment of disgust to force myself through. And then I could have carried on, just like before.

118.speaker: Astarion
118.text: The entire reason for my existence was to seduce anything with a pulse.

184.speaker: Astarion
184.text: And every instinct I have tells me that nothing's changed. That I'm still just a means to an end.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: You made me see I never stopped thinking like I was still his slave, even in freedom.

175.speaker: Astarion
175.text: But I'm more than that. More than a thing to be used.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: Open your mind so he sees you care.

110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion and the player stare at each other, mindmelding. He understands the player speaks the truth.

43.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player hugs Astarion, holding him for a long moment before breaking contact.

Tall player

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: You... you are full of surprises, aren't you?

108.speaker: Astarion
108.text: Honestly, I have no idea what we're doing. Or what comes next.

22.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Astarion takes the players hands.

Tall player

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: But I know that this? This is nice.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing the player, holding their handsNodeContext: 'This' referring to your relationship together

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: But I know that this? This is nice.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: NOT holding hands. Just enjoying being with Karlach (she can't touch).

42.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Astarion takes the players hands.

Tall player

88.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Astarion takes the players hands.

Short player

74.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player hugs Astarion, holding him for a long moment before breaking contact.

Short player

53.speaker: Player
53.text: You are worth a great deal to me, no matter what you are going through.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: We can be together without sleeping together, for as long as you need.

157.speaker: Astarion
157.text: Hah! Why that almost sounds like a challenge.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: What do you want to do?

143.speaker: Astarion
143.text: I... don't know. It's been so long since I've had to decide what I wanted.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Maybe what you really need is a friend, not a lover.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: I've held more people than I can count. An infinite parade of lovers.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: But a friend? I can't think of a single one.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing the player, holding their hands

163.speaker: Player
163.text: It might be better if we don't see each other anymore.

174.speaker: Astarion
174.text: It's a shame, but I don't want to risk treating you like you were one of his victims.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I slept with you because I wanted some fun, not to deal with this.

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: Yes. I suppose there's not much point in me if I won't have sex. My only talent, I'm fully aware.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Perhaps it's better if we don't continue with whatever this was. Perhaps we'll both be better for it.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: How often were you disgusted by your targets?

178.speaker: Astarion
178.text: I tried to pick beautiful people where I could, but there were so many over the years. After a while you stop caring.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Just repressed it and moved on? Sounds healthy.

186.speaker: Astarion
186.text: It's easy to judge a situation when you're not in it.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: So why sleep with me? Did you think you'd get something from it?

179.speaker: Astarion
179.text: People don't trust vampires - perhaps understandably - so I needed to get someone on my side. And seducing you was easy, frankly.

168.speaker: Astarion
168.text: So imagine how stupid I felt when I started to genuinely feel something for you.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: Trust me, I was not happy about it. You were a complication I didn't see coming. And yet...

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Are you getting sentimental on me?

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: Oh, don't look at me like that. I'm as surprised as you are.

185.speaker: Astarion
185.text: It's just... it would have been so easy to bite her. To just go along with what I was being told to do.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: You make your own choices now - for better or worse.

120.speaker: Astarion
120.text: It's been so long since I've had to make these decisions for myself. I won't lie, it's a daunting prospect.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: I was hoping that as reward for my support you'd throw yourself at me.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: I- I'm not sure if I should.

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: I don't think I want you to think of me in terms of sex.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: I don't know if I want anyone to.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: How do you want me to see you?

145.speaker: Astarion
145.text: As a person? Would that be so much to ask?

153.speaker: Player
153.text: Are you not attracted to me? Is that it?

123.speaker: Astarion
123.text: Of course I am - look at you!
123.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing to the player's body.

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: You're a vision. And you're so much more than that.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: ...I don't know what to think. I don't know what I want.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I'm not like all the others, I promise.

117.speaker: Astarion
117.text: I suppose it has felt different with you...

176.speaker: Astarion
176.text: I suppose... If this is what you want, then I shall provide.
176.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Astarian steps toward the player and out of frame.

Fade to black, cut back into it the next morning.NodeContext: A little downbeat

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Are you all right? What's wrong?

68.speaker: Player
68.text: If you have something to say, say it.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Don't tell me it was bad for you?

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: This is all a game to you, isn't it?
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion shifts to look at the player, sad and confrontationalNodeContext: confrontational - but sad, and doesn't have the energy for an argument

104.speaker: Astarion
104.text: No matter what I say, it doesn't matter. Not if you get what you want.
104.context: NodeContext: confrontational - but sad, and doesn't have the energy for an argument

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Of course not, it hurts to even hear you say that.

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: Well, you got what you wanted. An apology doesn't mean much at this point.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: But you seemed like you were enjoying it last night?

101.speaker: Astarion
101.text: Of course I did, I know that dance better than anyone. But I always felt nothing.

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: Not last night, though. Last night I felt miserable, and it was a revelation.

188.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion stands, and looks down at the player

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: For as long as I can remember, I've been used by others. Controlled and puppeted for someone else's pleasure. But not anymore.

140.speaker: Astarion
140.text: Whatever we had - whatever this was - it's over.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Why the Hells did you agree to sleep with me, then?

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: I didn't know how to say no.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: You should learn to enjoy sex for your own pleasure, and you should enjoy it with me.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Come, lie with me, you'll feel better about it then.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I regret stopping you. That potion would've really helped.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: It's a game I'm tired of playing. Being used.

148.speaker: Astarion
148.text: I thought I could bear sleeping with you, to try and get you on my side.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: Now I couldn't stand to do it again.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: For being so wonderful in bed?

149.speaker: Astarion
149.text: Unfortunate, because you're going to hear it.

164.speaker: Astarion
164.text: You stood up for me earlier, when that wretched drow was insisting I bite her. I appreciated it, that's all.

93.speaker: Astarion
93.text: Excuse me? This might be the first honest thing I've ever told you and you're 'not interested'?

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: It seems I was wrong about you. About us.

94.speaker: Astarion
94.text: Do you have a moment? I think we need to talk.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: About your undying love for me?

136.speaker: Astarion
136.text: Something like that. Except... not that at all.

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: Oh yes, I'm fine. I just-... feel awful.
69.context: NodeContext: Reflexively brushes it away before dropping the mask

87.speaker: Astarion
87.text: Look, I had a plan. A nice, simple plan - seduce you, sleep with you, manipulate your feelings so you'd never turn on me.

124.speaker: Astarion
124.text: It was easy - instinctive. Habits from two hundred years of charming people kicked in. All you had to do was fall for it.

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: And all I had to do was not fall for you... Which is where my nice, simple plan fell apart.

23.speaker: Astarion
23.text: You -... you're incredible. You deserve something real. I want us to be something real.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: So do I. More than anything.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: I just don't know what 'real' looks like. Not after two hundred years playing the rake.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: So the nights we spent together didn't mean anything?

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: Of course they did - that's the problem! Or part of it.

159.speaker: Astarion
159.text: Being close to someone - any kind intimacy - was something I performed to lure people back for him.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: Even though I know things between us are different, being with someone still feels... tainted. Still brings up those feelings of disgust and loathing.

128.speaker: Astarion
128.text: I don't know how else to be with someone. No matter how much I'd like to.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Were you even attracted to me? Or was it all a lie?

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: Of course I was attracted to you. Look at you, for goodness' sake!

165.speaker: Astarion
165.text: I - yes, all right. I can understand.
165.context: NodeContext: A little surprised, then sadly accepting

160.speaker: Astarion
160.text: Oh it's nothing terrible, it's just-... well, maybe it is a little terrible.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I'm not interested in hearing it.
